images.caption:
Placers on the Zlatý brook – winter aspect
Photo by P. Novotný

Placers on the Zlatý brook near the road to Lošov
Photo by P. Novotný

Placers intensely overgrown with vegetation
Photo by P. Novotný

Ideal trap for heavy minerals, water runs from right to left so that the rock layers are inclined against the water, heavy minerals are accumulated behind the rock layers
Photo by P. Novotný

Heavy minerals panned from the Zlatý brook: small brown and grey cubes – pyrite, green needles – malachite in quartz, white grain in the centre - cerussite
Photo by J. Zimák

Grain of gold 1.8 mm panned from the Zlatý brook
Photo by J. Zimák

Portal of the inherited Christ’s Help drift
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Opening of the bricked part of the inherited Christ’s Help drift with niches for pictures or statuettes of the patron saints of miners
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Portal of the exploratory František drift
Photo by J. Král

František drift – a corridor of a larger profile broke an older smaller drift partially based on a filling
Photo by J. Král

Trial stope of a smaller scope – tunnelled on an intersection of quartz veins, František drift
Photo by J. Král

Partially flooded further part of the exploratory František drift
Photo by J. Král

Heading face of the František drift, a mineralizing fault, already examined, is visible on the right
Photo by J. Král

Detail of a mineralizing fault coloured by limonite, František drift
Photo by J. Král

Panning of crushed stones from a mineralizing fault of the František drift
Photo by J. Král

Opening for water running from the subterranean spaces of the Goldgrund drift
Photo by P. Novotný

One of the trial pits tunnelled above the stopes of the Goldgrund drift; these pits were used for extraction of silver as early as prior to the 12th century according to a mining-historical study
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Trial pit with an active settlement of ground
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Research on slag heaps near trial pits over the Goldgrund drift
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Greyish white irregular plate of silver 2.5 mm (upper part of the sample in the middle in carbonate), yellow grain on the left – chalcopyrite
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Galena (grains of metallic lustre up to 7 mm) in a quartz vein in shale, yellow – chalcopyrite
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Quartz-carbonate vein with chalcopyrite (metallic yellow grains up to 10 mm) and galena (metallic grey)
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Slightly granular pyrite from a mineralizing fault in the František drift
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Green needles of malachite 2 mm in quartz
Photo by J. Král

Pyromorphite
Microphoto by P. Pauliš
